file_content.text: Good to see you again. That reminds me--those schematics... whatever happened to them?
You've been gone a while--I'm even working overtime.
My commander's calling every five minutes, bugging me about those schematics. You get them from the Justicars?
Yes.
Finally. Here's what I can pay you--plus a little extra for hazard duty.
And... can we keep this quiet? Hiring you to get this back makes the rest of us look bad.
Those schematics could be very helpful. Be sure they aren't wasted.
Put them to good use.
Well, my commander's real excited to see these secret passages. But we'll see if he actually follows through.
Either way, you spared my team a massive headache and probably even a few casualties.
Don't worry--my lips are sealed.
I won't tell anyone.
I appreciate that. Thank you for all your help. I'm sure I'll see you again.
If you can't do your job, that's your fault, not mine.
Maybe you deserve to look bad.
Don't say that. Morale around here is bad enough as it is.
Look, I appreciate your assistance with the schematics, but you should move on now.
I'm afraid I don't have anything for you just yet.
No.
Well, blast. Now I gotta explain the delay--again.
I don't want to waste any more of your time, though. Go ahead and get those schematics. We're counting on you.
What are you doing loafing? Find Fieler and get those stupid schematics back.
Jedi! Haven't seen one of you guys in ages. Not that I'm surprised--this place is a mess.
Don't tell me--the military's going to clean up this mess? We could use the help.
Look at this place. Nothing but freeloading tramps. I don't know why we bother.
I used to be proud to say, "Lieutenant Doorn, Coruscant Security Forces." These days, it's just a job. Doesn't even pay the bills.
You should be proud of what you do.
Don't be discouraged.
Right now, I'm just trying to keep my head above the garbage.
Sounds like things are rough.
It's that bad, eh?
Yeah, and it just keeps coming.
If you don't like the job, just quit.
Stop complaining.
I can't. This is my family's only income.
Now some stupid holodisc was stolen, and the commander wants me to deal with it!
I don't have the manpower to recover stolen intelligence! I--I can't just pull a commando unit out of my helmet, can I?
Perhaps I could be of assistance.
What about a Jedi?
The Force is capable of anything.
What about a Jedi?
If that's the case, then maybe you can deal with this situation.
You've got an elite commando unit right here.
You don't have to.
You're volunteering? I was probably gonna figure something out, but hey, I'll take you up on that.
I've seen some strange stuff, but that would probably be the strangest.
That might be fun to watch.
Heh. Well, if you really have been around, maybe you can handle this.
What exactly was stolen?
What kind of "intelligence"?
Why are you telling me this?
Look, I'm telling you this because you look like you could actually help me.
Here's the deal: You probably don't know 'em, but there're these weird secret passages running all over the planet.
Funny thing is, we didn't even know about these passages until the schematics were stolen off an old databank!
Why would anyone steal this information?
Stolen?
So they can sneak around the planet and get away with who knows what!
Someone should have realized how important the schematics were.
Sounds pretty disorganized.
Tell me about it. Now I gotta deal with someone else's mistake.
Apparently you guys didn't need the schematics anyway.
Why does it matter?
Yeah, but now that the commander's realized they exist, he wants to make use of them. Figures, don't it?
But the schematics weren't taken by some gutter thief. They were taken by the blasted Justicars!
Crazy vigilantes--the Justicars are armed to the teeth. Most of my security officers just flat-out refuse to tangle with them.
Isn't that their job?
Why?
Like I said, we don't get paid enough to stick our necks out too far.
Sometimes it's necessary to risk ourselves for the greater good.
Duty isn't always easy.
That's easy for a Jedi to say. My men don't see fighting the Justicars as a risk, they see it as suicide.
Your men must learn to control their feelings.
Fear is a difficult enemy.
Yeah, well, Jedi philosophy doesn't go too far in the streets.
It's unacceptable for an officer to refuse to do his duty.
Your men need discipline.
I've got to make do with the men I've got. We aren't the elite, like you.
I don't like vigilantes either, but your men won't make it far being cowards.
No risks, no rewards.
They aren't cowards, they just aren't equipped or paid enough to go up against the Justicars.
If your people won't do the job, why should I?
Sounds like you're cowards.
My team has some good men, but the Justicars are beyond any of us. Simple as that.
There's another detail: We don't know where the Justicars took the stolen schematics.
An agent from the Strategic Information Service was assigned to track the thieves, but she hasn't reported back in.
Rescuing this spy should be top priority.
We should find her.
Stolen schematics and a missing spy? How much are you asking me to do?
This is getting complicated.
Take it easy--I'm sure the spy's fine. She just might be able to help you track down the schematics.
You lost a spy, too?
Oh, she's probably fine. You know how flaky intelligence types can be.
Her name is Fieler Dan. A little old and a little batty, if you ask me.
Fieler's last known location was in Justicar territory. If she's done her job, she should know where to find those schematics.
Time to find out if this spy knows her business.
We'll see.
You can count on me.
I hope this is all worth it.
Now keep in mind--worthless as they may be, we're under strict orders to make sure these schematics aren't leaked to anyone.
So after you find old lady Fieler and recover the schematics, you make sure to bring them directly back to me. That's critical.
Look, I don't have time to talk. I got more to deal with than you can imagine.
